title: Phil Jagielka shouldn't have run to media to call Martin Atkinson arrogant, Graham Poll says
title_page: Phil Jagielka shouldn't have run to media to call Martin Atkinson arrogant, Graham Poll says | Daily Mail Online
text:
I know Martin Atkinson and I would describe him as one of the least arrogant men I have ever met.
However, if you read the comments that are attributed to Martin then you can understand why Phil Jagielka, who I know and respect, felt he was dealt with in quite an arrogant and off-hand manner.
But what really annoys me is that referees take so much nasty abuse and comments from players and when one might have said something which was perceived as arrogant, a player chooses to run to the media and tell all.
Phil Jagielka (second left) looks on as Sergio Aguero scores Manchester City's winner against Everton
Leon Osman protests to referee Martin Atkinson during the Capital One Cup semi-final second leg
Players don't need to be kind about referees but what they need to be is a little more even-handed.
If everything that a referee says to you that you don't like, you put in the media, then maybe a referee should do the same. Kids who are listening to these things then might not idolise these people so much.
It came out that Mark Clattenburg said 'you've changed' to Adam Lallana, who wasn't happy about it. Wow. And now Martin Atkinson.
You think, 'come on guys, these are the two top referees in the country that are going to the Euros, they are good referees'.
If they make a comment I just think players: grow up a bit. Come on.
